title: What Mac Davis songs provided the biggest hits for other artists? - Quora

response.answer_text: I wouldn’t say these weren’t the particular artist’s BIGGEST hits, but they were sizable… Elvis Presley recorded at least three of Mac’s songs: “A Little Less Conversation”, “Memories” and “In the Ghetto”. Bobby Goldsboro had his first Top 15 single in a few years with “Watchin’ Scotty Grow”, a song Mac wrote (and recorded originally) about his son Scott. Kenny Rogers and the First Edition had a huge hit with “Something’s Burning”. Gallery had the third (and last) of their Top 25 singles with their version of “I Believe In Music”. Davis was upset that they changed the line ‘God loves you when you sing’ to ‘Tell me what you see’.

Bobby Goldsboro had a #1 Adult Contemporary hit with Mac Davis's “Watching Scotty Grow”. The group Gallery hit big in 1972 with Mac's “I Believe in Music”. Kenny Rogers and his band The First Edition scored with “Something's Burning". And Elvis Presley enjoyed success with Mac Davis compositions like “Memories”, “In the Ghetto”, “A Little Less Conversation” and “Don't Cry, Daddy.”
